review_title: Job is ok. Pain to get anything changed, like salary.
job_title: IT Support Assistant in London, England
pros:
Equivalent annual leave to about 35 days a year!
Generally relaxed atmosphere.
Equal opportunities. No discrimination.
Ok salary.
cons:
Was initially not paid according to work I was doing and took a long time to change.
Far too bureaucratic.

job_title: Postdoctoral Research Associate in London, England
pros:
Flexible working hours dependent upon manager
Opportunity to get a wide breadth of experience - teaching, tutorials, lecturing, workshops, research, training
Great pension
Student discount permanently
cons:
Space is limited (central London)
Few positions open up as permanent roles (lecturers, prof's etc)

job_title: Strategic Partnerships Manager in London, England
pros:
People focused.
Lots of opportunities to get involved in other initiatives on top of your own job.
Lovely colleagues.
cons:
UCL is a huge university, which means that implementing change and getting decisions made.
Very risk-averse.
Limited opportunities for promotion outside of the academic sphere.

review_title: Was a nice experience there, but definitely do not want to stay for long term.
pros: way better work life balance compare to companies of course
cons: research groups doing unbelievably similar things and they share a lab.....very very bad and stressful

job_title: Postdoctoral Research Associate in London, England
pros: Many collaborations and contacts within the institution> Very well organized. Many resources at your disposal. Great location.
cons: Sometimes it can be not very goal oriented. That's a general problem of Academic Science.

pros:
- good brand (UCL) 
- wide range of experts which allow cross-sectional collaboration
cons:
- not enough space
- expensive to live near the campus
- overcrowded! (thanks to continuous merger and over recruitment of students)

job_title: Phd Student Researcher in London, England
pros: High class facilities and instruments lead to good reliable standards of research. Plus strong industry connections and courses for getting there.
cons: Lack of space and usage of resources is a real hamper on progress, especially during covid recovery

review_title: Great place to work, with plenty opportunity
pros: Good set of people, there is drive to modernise
cons: Trying to secure buy in from management is difficult as those who bring money to the university rule the roost i.e. Deans, Lecturers and Professionals

pros: Very good work and life balance
cons: Poor IT services and management however, very good standard of education for the students

pros:
Great academic staff and research environment. 
Good talks form academics worldwide.
cons:
Needs to be better communication to management.
Variable support between supervisors.

pros: Opportunities to interact with world-leading experts from various fields. Lots of opportunities for personal development. Very good connections to industry.
cons: A bit short on space. Ownership of IP by the university over PhD projects is too high.

pros:
Great colleagues and benefits.
Lots of resources available if you are working towards a professional qualification
cons:
Senior management only cares about themselves.
Not a great place if you want career progression.

job_title: Human Resources Business Partner in London, England
pros: Small team. opportunity to work with other HR teams and access self development
cons: Promotion limited due to structure, systems slow, change fatigue

review_title: Good experience overall with a few hiccups
pros: Excellent colleagues, good pay, great work-life balance
cons: Chauvinist management sometimes engage in shocking behavior with impunity

pros: Flexible, great people and brilliant teaching. Really nice facilities in central London too
cons: Sometimes the social side of PhD life can be lacking, and you can feel that you dont meet many people beyond your lab

pros:
Academic staff are usually helpful 

One of the best places to do research in mechanical engineering
cons: Administrative staff are fairly incompetent and slow.  Never hold themselves accountable or responsible for mismanaging staff and student issues

job_title: Postgraduate Teaching Assistant (F6) in London, England
pros: Contributing to students learning. Good pay. Informal environment. Good communication system setup (moodle)
cons: Work can be sometimes sparse and repetitive.

pros: Flexible working hours, good work life balance, intellectual stimulating environment
cons: Office space is poor, the university staff is expanding more than its infrastructure, but that is going to change in the next few years

pros: I have been here for a couple of weeks and the work ethic and inclusivity of the University is truly inspiring.
cons: There are quite long hours which, in addition to coursework can wear you out.

review_title: Good University but the salary  isn't following
job_title: Postgraduate Teaching Assistant in London, England
pros: Large campus with a world reknown team, small groups of students and high responsiblity job.
cons: Low pay and lots of extra hours demanded without being paid. PTA need urgent salary raise!

pros: One of the best universities in the UK. Strong academic research atmosphere
cons: In central London, a bit noisy and expensive. But if you like the buzz, it would be best.

pros:
Good infrastructure, resources, core facilities etc. 
Hub of world-class research,
Learn from people with various academic, industrial, professional backgrounds.
cons:
Can feel isolated at such a big university/organisation
IT resources could be improved
Lots of paperwork/standard operating procedures etc.

review_title: Many opportunities at University College London
pros: Got the position of a Programming Mentor after doing well in my first year programming exams.  Looked nice on my CV.
cons: They pay you at the end of a term.

pros: Very dynamical environment. Great science and plenty of opportunities for high-quality collaborations. Lots of resources.
cons: Nothing particularly bad, the same cons that could be found in any other academic environment.

review_title: The focus is on their ground-breaking research, not you
pros:
Awe-inspiring cutting edge research happening around you
Great location
A lot of cultural and scientific events occuring
cons:
Competitive environment
Poor progression opportunities
Cramped and chaotic working space

review_title: Payment Issues if non UK/EU citizen
pros: They pay well and have proper procedures for payment.
cons: The laws do not allow them to hire non-UK/EU students with a Tier4 visa full time even for just two weeks.

job_title: Postdoctoral Research Associate in London, England
pros: Central London location, easy to commute. Laid back working hours
cons: Terrible food options inside the campus and not cheap. There is nothing good about being a Postdoc.

pros:
EPSRC scholarship covers IT equipment and travel allowance.
Great infrastructure, access to online and offline libraries, amazing high performance computing capabilities.
cons: The stipends should be significantly larger in order to cover the London expenses.

pros:
- UCL is slowly but surely becoming one of the best universities in the world
- great people working there
cons:
- pretty big beaurocracy
- can feel anonymous
- can feel chaotic
- facilities could be better

review_title: Comfortable to work for but becoming too Political
job_title: Senior Research Associate in London, England
pros: Lots of opportunities for training courses
cons: More so at senior management  the atmosphere has become too political over the last 5 years. Losing focus on its academic strengths.

review_title: Great place to contribute and learn
pros: UCL is a place to challenge your creativity by bringing theory into practice.
cons: Nothing to do really with UCL, but London is a high maintenance city to live in.

job_title: Phd Student Researcher in London, England
pros: Enjoyed my time there, I was flexible in managing my schedules and research project
cons: Pros and cons depends on the supervisor/department.

review_title: Nice place to work (Division of Psychiatry)
job_title: PhD Student/Research Assistant in London, England
pros: Friendly department, very good UCL infrastructure (library, digital services, student support services), location
cons: My department favours clinical academics over non-clinical ones

pros: Extremely collaborative and supportive environment. Good, balanced working culture  and great benefits (annual leave, training etc.) Intellectually stimulating environment.
cons: It's a big University so can be difficult to navigate sometimes

review_title: One of best universities in London and the UK
job_title: Postdoctoral Research Associate in London, England
pros: The main campus is in central London. It is multi-diverse university from its foundation.
cons: Some buildings have old and unusual layout and can be sometimes work-unfriendly

review_title: PhD Researcher - great access to resources and expertise.
pros: Abundance of facilities and professional expertise.
cons: PhD researchers culture - there is no feeling you actually belong to a cohort - everyone's on their own.

pros: Many nice academic colleagues.
cons: The management is getting worse: too many micro-management. The work load including teaching, marking and administrative role is quite high. Get promoted is difficult.

review_title: Ok environment and team but terrible senior management and HR ethos
pros: Academia, flexible, good location, nice staff
cons: Constant cutbacks due to overstretch if themselves to expand the university. All core facilities cut to the bare bone

pros: Excellent facilities and opportunities. Very liberal, and makes great effort to increase diversity amongst student population and workforce.
cons: Very short of physical space and desk space.

pros: Well renowned university, good annual leave and generally a friendly working environment.
cons: Poor management and very little information flow down to the coal face. Very little internal movement or career development.

pros: Dynamic work environment. Nice place where to work.
cons: Perspectives are limited. Need to find funding to succed and have perspectives (however this is related to the position rather than the company).

pros: Expert talent, great possibilities for learning and networking. Very bright students to interact with.
cons: Casual contracts, lack of transparency and openness about some aspects (e.g. no formal written contracts with PhD students)

review_title: Nice colleagues, plenty of opportunities to grow
pros:
- Colleagues are very smart and also friendly
- Plenty of support and opportunities to build both academic and non-academic skills
cons: - Can be stressful and competitive

review_title: In the centre of London, nice people, to difficult to get permanent position
pros: Nice location, interesting people but as friends.
cons: The management and PIs are not busy with mentoring.

review_title: As always with science: great job, miserable pay
pros: UCL is a fantastic place to work. Atmosphere is very warm and productive.
cons: There certain idiotic rules written by highest management to 'save money'.

pros:
- One of the best universities in the world.
- Great people and atmosphere.
cons: - Quite a competitive environment (which made me push myself a lot so really a con!).

pros:
Good pay and flexibility
No need for previous experience
cons: They pay you at the end of the next month so you have to wait 2 months for your first paycheck

review_title: Research Technician at the Cancer Institute

cons: Not many Cons for a Research Technician

review_title: Nice holiday - not worth it for the poor culture

Excellent work/life balance

Excellent teams
